intro: Hermbstaedtia ovata, commonly known as the slender sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Hermbstaedtia ovata thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or disturbed areas. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
